intro: Boechera calcarea, commonly known as the limestone rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This species is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. Boechera calcarea typically grows in open, sunny areas such as cliffs, slopes, and gravelly soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
